channel.title: Windows Defender error?
channel.description:
Sorry if this is the wrong section.
For the past 4 months I've had this problem. Windows Defender is always turned off.
[IMG]http://i56.tinypic.com/xnrlo3.jpg[/img]
I click "Turn on and open Windows Defender" and this error pops up.
[IMG]http://i53.tinypic.com/11wetf4.jpg[/img]
I go to my services and look at Defender. It says it starts automatically. But I right clicked on it and clicked start and it gives me an error.
[IMG]http://i51.tinypic.com/65x5s5.jpg[/img]
How can I fix this? Ive booted into safe mode and then it would let me run it. But recently, it still gives me the same error even when I'm on safe mode. Ive done numerous virus scans with Malware Bytes, Microsoft Security Essentials, Kaspersky, AVG. None of them found anything.

item.title: Windows Defender error?
item.dc:creator: @kicker862 kicker862
item.description:
@kicker862 wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:4, topic:386232”]I know its not a fix and slightly off-topic, but use MalwareBytes.

But what that error message means is that the licence has expired for windows or windows defender for whatever reason.

check here: http://support.microsoft.com/kb/931849[/quote]

How do I renew it?
**Nvm I read the rest of that page lol.

Is Microsoft Security Essentials good enough?
I just want Defender to be fixed so its more support. And I mainly posted this because I thought it had to do with a virus.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows Defender error?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“kicker862, post:3, topic:386232”]Updates were installed: 3/9/2011
One optional update available: Microsoft SQL Server 2008 Service Pack 2 (KB2285068)[/quote]That shouldn’t make a difference. I would google that error and see if anything pops up, but I’d say that if those utilities you mentioned reported no problems, there probably isn’t anything wrong. You shouldn’t be relying on windows defender for your security anyway.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows Defender error?
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

I know its not a fix and slightly off-topic, but use MalwareBytes.

But what that error message means is that the licence has expired for windows or windows defender for whatever reason.

check here: http://support.microsoft.com/kb/931849

Read full topic

item.title: Windows Defender error?
item.dc:creator: @kicker862 kicker862
item.description:
@kicker862 wrote:

Updates were installed: 3/9/2011
One optional update available: Microsoft SQL Server 2008 Service Pack 2 (KB2285068)

Read full topic

item.title: Windows Defender error?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Have you tried updating with windows update?

item.title: Windows Defender error?
item.dc:creator: @kicker862 kicker862
item.description:
@kicker862 wrote:

Sorry if this is the wrong section.

For the past 4 months I’ve had this problem.
Windows Defender is always turned off.

I click “Turn on and open Windows Defender” and this error pops up.

I go to my services and look at Defender.
It says it starts automatically.
But I right clicked on it and clicked start and it gives me an error.

How can I fix this?
Ive booted into safe mode and then it would let me run it. But recently, it still gives me the same error even when I’m on safe mode.
Ive done numerous virus scans with Malware Bytes, Microsoft Security Essentials, Kaspersky, AVG. None of them found anything.
